intro: Gilia laciniata var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine gilia, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often purple or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This variety is adapted to harsh mountain environments, showcasing resilience and unique botanical features.
